# duration

**Instance Property**

The number of seconds it took for the user to speak the utterance represented by the segment.

## Declaration

```swift
var duration: TimeInterval { get }
```

## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.speech/documentation/Speech/SFTranscriptionSegment/duration] contains the number of seconds it took for the user to speak the one or more words (utterance) represented by the segment. For example, the [doc://com.apple.speech/documentation/Speech/SFSpeechRecognizer] sets [doc://com.apple.speech/documentation/Speech/SFTranscriptionSegment/duration] to `0.6` if the user took `0.6` seconds to say `“time”` in the transcription of `“What time is it?"`.

## Getting audio timing information

- **timestamp**: The start time of the segment in the processed audio stream.
